availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: Adjutant General Letter Book - No. 3 ; 9 April - 25 May 1864

body.p:
261
Stanton Ky
May 1s 1864
Hardwick. J. N. B.
Knox. George
Scholl J. H
Pettit G. M.

To the Governor stating that the frequency of guerrilla raids into the County has rendered the residence of Union men there very unsafe. State that Capt Cockrill Company of the 47th was raised in that county and would give ample protection if ordered there

Head Quarters Ky. Vols.
Adjutant General's Office
Frankfort -- Ky. May 9th/64
Respectfully forwarded to Brig. Gen. Burbridge Comm'd'g Dist of Ky. as having sole jurisdiction in this matter

By order of the Governor
John Boyle
Adjt. Gen. of Ky.
